google.intro: Connect a Google Sheet to automatically configure and populate a component.
google.step1Description: Choose the component that will be synchronized with Google Sheets.
google.step2Description: Provide the Google Sheet details that will be used to configure the component.
google.connectError: Failed to connect the Google Sheet. Please try again.
google.sheetAlreadyLinkedOrders: This sheet/tab is already linked to Orders. Choose another tab/store name.
google.sheetNotFound: We couldn't find this sheet/tab. Please check the tab name and try again.
google.overrideConfirmMessage: The current Orders configuration will be reset and replaced by the Google Sheet. Continue?
google.successDetail: Google Sheet connection saved. The component will be configured shortly.
google.domainRequired: Please select a component before continuing.
google.fileRequired: Select a Google Sheet before continuing.
google.uploadCredentialHint: Upload the service account JSON key to let EMA access Google Sheets.
google.removeCredentialsConfirm: Remove the stored Google service account JSON? Existing syncs will stop working until a new key is uploaded.
google.serviceAccountReadOnly: Service account managed by an administrator.
google.credentialsUploadError: Failed to store the service account JSON. Please check the file and try again.
google.credentialsRemoveError: Failed to remove the stored credentials.
google.credentialsStatusError: Failed to load service account status.
google.serviceAccountMissing: Upload a service account JSON before continuing.
google.howToApis: How to enable Sheets + Drive APIs?
google.howToStep1: Open the Google Cloud Console and sign in with an administrator account.
google.howToStep2: Select the project used for EMA. Enable the Google Sheets API (and Google Drive API if needed).
google.howToStep3: Go to IAM & Admin → Service Accounts, create (or choose) a service account, then under Keys click Add key → Create new key and pick JSON. Download the file.
google.howToStep4: Open the Google Sheet you want to sync and share it with the service account email shown in the JSON (Editor access).
google.howToStep5: Back in EMA, upload the JSON below and click Test connection to confirm access.
google.howToApisStep1: Open the Google Cloud Console API dashboard.
google.howToApisStep2: Check the project selector in the top bar. Switch to your EMA project if needed.
google.howToApisStep3: In the left sidebar choose APIs & Services → Library.
google.howToApisStep4: Search for Google Sheets API, open it, and click Enable.
google.howToApisStep5: Click + ENABLE APIS AND SERVICES again, search for Google Drive API, and enable it.
google.howToApisStep6: Return to APIs & Services → Dashboard to confirm both APIs show as enabled.
google.howToApisStep7: Optional: go to Credentials to verify your service account and JSON key are listed.
google.howToApisStep8: Ensure the service account email matches the one you shared the Google Sheet with.
google.testConnectionError: Failed to read the sheet. Verify sharing permissions and the tab name.
google.domainNotConnected: {{ domain }} is not connected to Google Sheets yet.
google.duplicateSheetError: You can't link the same Google Sheet twice.
